messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] univeristy, was just saying hi
messages.msgSnippet: ... Full scholarship.  The music department wanted to be sure they had us before they forked out the money. ... It was possible to not declare a major, but it
messages.messageBody:
7/7/03 22:33:

> In Iowa, huh? But just for scholarship purposes?

Full scholarship. The music department wanted to be sure they had us before
they forked out the money.
>
> How sad for the kids, at 17 or 18, to be fored to declare before they could
> check out the things they had never heard of.

It was possible to not declare a major, but it made it harder to get any
courses you really wanted to take. Smart people with no monetary
obligations changed majors every semester or year -- that way they got
priority for the handful of classes they wanted, and in the end, they
declared a General Studies major or something and got a degree. People who
learned to play the game!
>
> I hope they weren't making it too horribly difficult to change majors.

Simple form to change. But that's why my BA is in music -- if I had changed
majors, I would have lost my scholarship. That was the difficult part of
the decision.

brenda
